content.text:
I'll help you explore this codebase to understand its structure and get warmed up for planning tasks.

Let me start by examining the project structure and key files:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="read_file">
<parameter name="path">D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM\README.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<parameter name="output_format">
text
</parameter>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="glob">
<parameter name="pattern">D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM\*.{py,json,md,txt,yaml,yml}</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd "D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM" && dir /B /A:D</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="read_file">
<parameter name="path">D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM\main.py</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd "D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM" && find . -type f -name "*.py" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="read_file">
<parameter name="path">D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM\requirements.txt</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd "D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM" && dir /B /S *.py | findstr /V "__pycache__" | findstr /V ".git"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="glob">
<parameter name="pattern">D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM\**\__init__.py</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Now let me explore the main directories:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd "D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM" && tree /F /A | head -50</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd "D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM" && for /D %d in (*) do @echo %d</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd "D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM" && dir /B</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check package structure:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="read_file">
<parameter name="path">D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM\package.json</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd "D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM" && ls -la</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me explore the Python package structure:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="glob">
<parameter name="pattern">D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM\*\*.py</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd "D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM" && git log --oneline -10</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the recent changes:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd "D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM" && git diff HEAD main.py</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me explore the codebase structure more systematically:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="glob">
<parameter name="pattern">D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM\**\*.py</parameter>
<parameter name="excludePatterns">["**/__pycache__/**", "**/.git/**", "**/venv/**", "**/node_modules/**"]</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Now let me examine key configuration files:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="read_file">
<parameter name="path">D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM\QUICKSTART.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd "D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM" && cat run.bat</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Perfect! I'm now warmed up and have a good understanding of this codebase. Here's what I've discovered:

## Codebase Overview

**Open-AutoGLM** appears to be an automation framework built in Python, likely for automated testing or task execution based on the structure and naming conventions.

### Key Findings:

1. **Main Entry Point**: `D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM\main.py` - The primary application entry point with recent modifications

2. **Project Structure**:
   - Python-based project with modular architecture
   - Multiple Python files across different subdirectories
   - Configuration files for different run modes (run.bat, run-simple.bat, run-debug.bat)
   - Git repository with active development (recent commits about Didi error fixes and delay config support)

3. **Recent Changes**:
   - Modified `main.py` (uncommitted changes)
   - Recent work on error handling (Didi error fix)
   - Support for delay configuration added
   - WeChat group integration (5th group for 25-30 users)

4. **Development Setup**:
   - Has requirements.txt for Python dependencies
   - Multiple batch files for different execution modes
   - Shell script (run.sh) for cross-platform support
   - QUICKSTART.md guide for new users

5. **Untracked Files**:
   - `.claude/` directory (likely Claude Code integration files)
   - `.env` file (environment configuration)
   - Multiple run scripts (bat and sh)
   - QUICKSTART.md documentation

I'm ready to help you plan implementations, explore architectural patterns, or design solutions for any requirements you'd like to work on! Just provide me with the specific requirements and any perspective you'd like me to apply.
